title: Using Slope Vegetation for Direction Finding
brief: Determine direction by observing vegetation and moisture differences on north vs south-facing slopes.
steps: Step 1: Identify slopes that face different directions.
Step 2: In Northern Hemisphere, observe that north-facing slopes are cooler and damper.
Step 3: In summer, look for patches of snow remaining on north-facing slopes.
Step 4: In winter, observe that south-facing slopes lose snow first and have shallower snowpack.
Step 5: Note that vegetation is typically more lush on south-facing slopes in Northern Hemisphere.
warnings: Works opposite in Southern Hemisphere - south-facing slopes are cooler and damper.
Local weather patterns and terrain can create exceptions to these rules.
Most reliable when comparing multiple slopes in the same area.
